description.narrative: The need for effective and rules-based water governance in the Greater Mekong region has never been so apparent. Economic growth, future quality of life and regional stability are strongly linked to the choices made by countries on how to share, develop and manage water to produce food and energy, maintain vital ecosystems and sustain livelihoods. Australia provides $9.86 million grant to Australian Water Partnership to manage Australia-Mekong Water Facility (2019-2023). Through this Facility it will provide government to government line of cooperation, it will offer a responsive, nimble and flexible mechanism for Australia to further enhance our existing water-related partnerships with the governments of the region. The overall goal of the Facility is to enhance rules-based governance for water, food and energy security in the Greater Mekong region.
